description:
1. Cover by Paris Cullins and Ernie Colon.
  2. "Sleepwalker" written by Dan Mishkin and Gary Cohn, penciled Ric Estrada and inked by Romeo Tanghal, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by John Costanza.

Although the habitual passage to the Gemworld is still closed, Amethyst is once again in this world while her physical body remains on her earth house, at Hudson city.

Some islanders from the Aquamarine's islands disagree with the methods of their leader, Lord Aquamarine. Fire Jade uses one of this islanders, Quaar, to fight this Lord. Lord Sardonyx finds that his castle seems to have disappeared.

This issue starts out the outside of the Winston's home Carnelian is outside seeing just like we all are that Amy aka Amethyst is sleeping in a trance separated from each other. Her mother Marion wants to be next to her and wake her up but that might mean death. We then head to Gemworld where we see Citrina in a fever like state and Amethyst's magic can not penetrate whatever has Citrina. Being careful Amethyst puts Citrina in a bed of flowers to hold Citrina so she doe. s not wander aimlessly. She then goes off to be with Garnet who is at a convocation of the Nobles at the Diamond Temple. We see a fisherman named Quaar who is fighting a sea monster which is pretty cool to see. He then is next seen coming to shore with the beast hauled in.

Having a big feast the village dines on the beach only to be persecuted by one of Lord Aquamarine's henchmen.

In a poof of magic Fire Jade appears and destroys the henchmen and tricks the villagers to help her. Amethyst arrives but sees Aquamarine and Turquoise leaving.Suddenly Prince Topaz attacks them only to knock Turquoise off to catch her and on the ground near an unseen Amethyst embrace each other leaving us with seeing tears in Amethyst eyes. Fire Jade sends Quaar and the village fisherman to rile up and attack Aquamarines palace. Unbeknownst to Quaar and his friends Fire jade is using them so that she might rule by any means necessary. Amethyst is still at the Diamond Temple and unknowingly brings in a creature she briefly battles it and is able to send it back through the portal. Meanwhile we get a cameo of the Monitor and Lyla looking at a sleeping Amy. We then see Lord Sardonyx going home but home is not there.
name: Sleepwalkers

description:
Night-Slayer captures Nocturna and Jason Todd, forcing Batman to confront him.

Is This the END of the... Bat Man!?

Many from Batmans rogues gallery are seen in a hallucination.
name: End of the Bat

description: Stuck in the past, Metamorpho falls under Ahk-ton's control.
name: Who Wears the Crown of Ra?

description: A best of collection for the Legion of Super-Heroes, including some origin stories.
name: Legion of Super Heroes: a Tale of Revenge

description:
Superman and the Forgotten Heroes must stop the Triad from controlling the universe! Who is this mysterious figure watching over Earth?

  1. Cover by Eduardo Barreto.
  2. "The Triad" written by Marv Wolfman, penciled by Curt Swan, inked by Dave Hunt, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Ben Oda.

Animal Man, Cave Carson, Congorilla, Dolphin, Immortal Man, Rick Flagg and Rip Hunter, collectively known as the Forgotten Heroes, along with Superman, have been hurled into the future, by 18th Century Polish wizard Krakow, to combat the Faceless Hunter From Saturn. The alien giant rains stones down upon the heroes. Superman vaporizes the majority of the stones with his heat vision. One, however, gets past him. The falling stone is about to crush Dolphin, when the Immortal Man pushes her out of the way, taking the fatal hit himself. Superman and Congorilla topple the Faceless Hunter From Saturn. Burying the Faceless Hunter From Saturn beneath the desert sand, Superman than fuses the sand into glass, before striking his opponent. Superman carries the Faceless Hunter From Saturn high into the air, only to lose his grip, when his hands begin burning. Animal Man soars skyward to enter into the combat. Superman blocks the Faceless Hunter From Saturn from felling Animal Man, before taking the giant down, with a double-fisted haymaker. His foe defeated, Superman interrogates the Faceless Hunter from Saturn, regarding the Enchantress' and Krakow's scheme. Rotting in prison on his home planet Klaramar, the Faceless Hunter From Saturn was approached by the Enchantress. The evil sorceress offered the villainous alien his freedom, in return for his tracking down the location of a third, alien, sorcerer, to complete the Triad with her and Krakow.

The Immortal Man returns to life, reincarnated as a young boy. Superman flies the Forgotten Heroes into space, en route to the alien sorcerer's planet, Yggardis. The only route to Yggardis takes the heroes through a red star system. Superman is forced to turn back, or else lose his powers under the red sun. Superman takes the Forgotten Heroes to the water world, Qaria. For several moments, Dolphin believes that her own origins may have began on Qaria, but the native inhabitants' gills put the lie to that notion. Though the Qarians do not possess space travel capability, they put the heroes in contact with the Space Cabby. Dissension begins to form in the ranks of the Forgotten Villains. Mister Poseidon, The Atom-Master, and Ultivac fear that the Enchantress, once gaining ultimate power from the union of the Triad, will not honor her promises to them. The Enchantress, Krakow, and the alien sorcerer of Yggardis begin the ceremony to increases their sorcerous might. The alien sorcerer lashes out at Space Cabby's shuttle, forcing him to crash land on a different world, before he can reach Yggardis. As feared, the Enchantress, having gained ultimate power, turns against her "allies" in the Forgotten Villains, and begins to conquer the world, solely for herself. Superman, Space Cabby, and the Forgotten Heroes are rescued by Chris KL-99, and his two alien companions, Jero and Halk. The band of heroes finish their journey to Yggardis, in Chris KL-99's starship, The Pioneer.

Arriving in orbit over Yggardis, the Pioneer comes under attack from enormous steel tentacles, rising up from the very planet itself. Before he can help, Superman is caught in the grip of a tentacle, and dragged down into Yggardis' molten core. The Forgotten Heroes mount a rescue operation, led by Carson, to retrieve the Man of Steel. With the Triad complete, Krakow uses his sorcerous might to conquer the past, while the Enchantress dominates the present. Refusing to become the Enchantress' thrall, the Atom-Master creates a nightmarish creature to oppose her. Taking advantage of the opportunity, Mister Poseidon instructs Ultivac to lend his power to the Atom-Master's assault. Taking on the attributes of an alien "gopher", that lives in the molten core of Yggardis, Animal Man pulls Superman out of the magma pool. The band of heroes makes their way back to the Pioneer. Realizing that the planet Yggardis itself is the alien sorcerer, Chris KL-99 bombards the surface of Yggardis with the Pioneer's laser cannons. Suffering immense pain, Yggardis breaks off his connection to Krakow and the Enchantress. The Triad broken, all three sorcerer's suffer an immense loss of power. Moments away from defeat at the hands of the Forgotten Villains, the Enchantress uses the last of her fading magic to teleport away. Having said their farewells to Space Cabby and Chris KL-99, Superman flies the Forgotten Heroes back to 18th Century Poland, to retrieve Hunter's Time Sphere, and Carson's Mighty Mole. There they find Krakow's castle fortress in ruins. Having watched the entire affair, the Monitor, with his assistant, Lyla, makes ready to initiate his own machinations.

Notes:

  • "Meanwhile..." contains a tribute to Don Newton by Dick Giordano and Pat Bastienne.
name: The Triad

description:
The Phantom Stranger introduces himself and predicts that the spirit of a dead man will challenge Firestorm. Ronnie has a nightmare in which he is attacked by a man who calls Firestorm in to assist him. Ronnie's planned job interviews are missed when a freak storm develops over New York Harbor. Firestorm flies to rescue passengers on the Staten Island Ferry and meets the Phantom Stranger who gives him an ominous warning. A strange black rip appears in the storm clouds, and a ghostly menace emerges from the past appears to rip apart the very essence of Firestorm!

Firestorm826's Panel-by-Panel Story Summary (Spoiler Alert)

‚ÄúMen call me ‚ÄòThe Phantom Stranger.‚Äô I have other names in other places‚Ä¶Know then - - there are boundaries that no mortal soul may break!‚Äù the mysterious man says, ‚ÄúMost sacred is that which separates life and death. But tonight, the hate-filled spirit of a dead man is straining to cross over‚Ä¶and face the Fury of Firestorm, the Nuclear Man.‚Äù

Ronnie Raymond lays asleep in his bed, restlessly turning in his covers as his mind dreams. He stands alone on a strange rocky landscape. A shadow figure lurks behind him, unseen. ‚ÄúWhere am I?‚Äù Ronnie asks, ‚ÄúI‚Äôve got the weirdest feeling I‚Äôve seen this place before - - like in the ‚ÄòTwilight Zone!‚Äô This better be a dream or I‚Äôm in big trouble‚Ä¶‚Äù

Suddenly, the figure in the shadows lunges to attack! The man leaps at Ronnie from behind, landing a stunning elbow across the base of Ronnie‚Äôs skull! Ronnie tumbles to the ground under the weight of his attacker. ‚ÄúDream, heck - - it‚Äôs more like a nightmare!‚Äù he exclaims. He twists and turns on the ground, wrestling and jostling to face his attacker. ‚ÄúDie! Die!‚Äù the man yells, squeezing at Ronnie‚Äôs throat with both of his hands. Ronnie flexes his leg into the man‚Äôs midsection, flinging him up and away. ‚ÄúWhat are you, a maniac?‚Äù Ronnie yells, ‚ÄúGet off me!‚Äù

The man slowly gets to his feet and points off in the distance. ‚ÄúIf I can‚Äôt waste you, punk, I‚Äôve got a pal who can do it for me!‚Äù he snarls. From over his shoulder, an angry Firestorm appears. ‚ÄúDie, Ronnie Raymond! Die! So I can live!‚Äù the man yells, beckoning Firestorm to attack! The Nuclear Man lunges forward at the terrified Ronnie. ‚ÄúNooooo!‚Äù Ronnie yells, ‚ÄúNoooooo!‚Äù

Ronnie awakens from the nightmare startled and out of breath. ‚ÄúMan! That was the grand-daddy of nightmares!‚Äù he sighs in wakeful relief, ‚ÄúScary‚Ä¶and weird, too!‚Äù Ronnie changes into a T-shirt and pants and drifts down the hallway to the kitchen. ‚ÄúWho knows, maybe I‚Äôm cracking up,‚Äù he thinks, ‚ÄúSure, with all the problems in my life‚Ä¶Two girlfriends, Doreen and Firehawk‚Ä¶And now, looking for a job‚Ä¶No wonder I‚Äôm flaking out. I guess part of me sees Firestorm as a problem, too‚Ä¶a threat to my future!‚Äù

He reaches into the refrigerator for the milk. Pouring himself a glass, he tries to find a reason to explain the nightmare. ‚ÄúThis is silly‚Ä¶What does Professor Stein call it? Supermarket psychology,‚Äù he tells himself, ‚ÄúIt was probably just the frozen pizza I had last night before bed!‚Äù Ronnie‚Äôs father Ed walks in. ‚ÄúYou okay, son? I thought I heard you cry out last night‚Ä¶‚Äù his Dad asks. Ronnie turns to him and answers, ‚ÄúNothing spectacular, Dad‚Ä¶Just a nightmare. It was pretty off-the-wall, though - - I dreamed about that gangster, ‚ÄòShoe‚Äô Shine that killed Mom and almost killed you before he was gunned down by the FBI‚Ä¶‚Äù The mention of that name stirs concern in his Dad‚Äôs face. ‚Äú‚ÄôShoe‚Äô Shine?‚Äù he asks cautiously. ‚ÄúJust a nightmare‚Ä¶‚Äù Ronnie reassuringly answers.

Half an hour later, as Ronnie says goodbye to Ed Raymond, outside the ‚ÄòDaily Express‚Äô office, the nightmare is already a fading memory‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúWish me luck on my interviews, Dad - - meet you here at six for dinner, okay?‚Äù Ronnie says with a wave. ‚ÄúTry WGBS, Ronald,‚Äù his Dad answers, ‚ÄúI should be there all afternoon. They have a political panel. Your father - - the expert!‚Äù

Ronnie turns and walks down the stairs to the subway. ‚ÄúJob interviews - - ung. I hate this a lot,‚Äù he thinks, ‚ÄúMight as well rehearse the old resume‚Ä¶Let‚Äôs see‚Ä¶Academic achievements‚Ä¶Uh - - maybe I should start with personal cleanliness‚Ä¶‚Äù

Meanwhile, above New York Harbor, an event begins which will make Ronnie late for his first interview of the day‚Ä¶an event as inexplicable as it is catastrophic. A strange black cloud forms over the Hudson River. Lightning and thunder roll out from it across the sky. Suddenly, storm clouds begin to circulate menacingly. They begin spinning more and more rapidly, forming a funnel that descends to the water as a tornado springs to life! The Hudson becomes restless, churning waves and wind as the tornado sweeps along. Passengers on a nearby ferry cling fearfully to the deck rails as their ship is tossed about.

Ronnie walks down onto the subway platform, still mentally rehearsing his job interview. ‚Äú‚ÄôHi, Mr. Weston‚Ä¶‚Äô No, no‚Ä¶‚ÄôGood morning, sir. I‚Äôd really like to be a part of the Pizza Bunker family‚Ä¶‚Äô That‚Äôs better,‚Äù he thinks. He walks past the newsstand. Its radio loudly blares music, until suddenly‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúWe interrupt this broadcast to report an emergency,‚Äù an anxious voice crackles over the radio speaker, ‚ÄúA freak storm has erupted over the Harbor - - endangering several hundred passengers aboard the Staten Island Ferry. The Coast Guard has been dispatched‚Ä¶‚Äù Ronnie looks at the radio in shock. He turns and runs away from the busy platform, searching for a secluded spot. ‚ÄúDamn! There‚Äôs one job interview down the tubes!‚Äù he worries as he sprints. He runs down an access stair to track level. A subway train is rushing towards him. ‚ÄúHope you‚Äôre not doing anything too important, Professor‚Ä¶‚Äù Ronnie thinks. BEEEEEE! The subway sounds its horn as it races towards Ronnie‚Ä¶but he disappears!

Simultaneously, at Concordance Research - - Professor Martin Stein blinks as a familiar nuclear transformation tugs at his very identity‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúOh, for Heaven‚Äôs sake‚Ä¶‚Äù he mutters, turning away from his experiment. It is a transformation that fuses two beings into one, student and scientist becoming - - Firestorm, the Nuclear Man! Ronnie flies up through the street as the subway train roars past just below him. ‚ÄúRonald, you know I‚Äôll never be able to finish an experiment if you continue to interrupt me‚Ä¶‚Äù Stein sighs. Ronnie quickly explains the reason for their fusion. ‚ÄúListen to the radio sometime, Professor!‚Äù he replies, ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs an emergency out in the Harbor!‚Äù

Secluded and undetected behind the spire of a nearby building, the Phantom Stranger watches Firestorm. He leans a white-gloved hand against the spire, and his hat brim is pulled low, shielding his eyes. ‚ÄúThe Unholy is winning!‚Äù he says softly, ‚ÄúThe two are again one and the dead dreamer comes ever nearer! This must not be‚Ä¶‚Äù

Firestorm arrives at the Harbor as the tornado spins furiously toward the helpless ferry. ‚ÄúThis is impossible, Ronald! Such an electrical phenomenon cannot occur simultaneously!‚Äù Stein gasps as he assesses the storm. ‚ÄúTell it to those guys on the boat, Professor,‚Äù Ronnie replies, ‚ÄúBetter yet, let‚Äôs‚Ä¶Whoa!‚Äù Suddenly, the Phantom Stranger appears directly in Firestorm‚Äôs path! Ronnie pulls to a quick mid-air stop to avoid a collision. ‚ÄúHalt! You must not proceed!‚Äù the Phantom Stranger orders, ‚ÄúThere is great danger ahead for you! Life and death are the stakes in this game!‚Äù

Ronnie looks over the mysterious man, searching his memory. ‚ÄúWait a minute!‚Äù he says, pointing at him, ‚ÄúI know you‚Ä¶Seen your file in the JLA computers‚Ä¶You‚Äôre the - - it‚Äôll come to me in a - - the Phantom Stranger! Wow, this is great! You want to help?‚Äù The Phantom Stranger scowls back, answering, ‚ÄúIf you know of me, youngster, then you know that the Phantom Stranger tells no untruths! More than just your existence is at stake here‚Ä¶The natural laws of Order and Chaos are threatened‚Ä¶You must not remain as Firestorm!‚Äù Ronnie is more concerned with the task at hand right now. ‚ÄúWhat are you talking about, Stranger?‚Äù he asks in surprise, ‚ÄúPeople are in danger right below us! They need my help and they need it now!‚Äù He turns to fly down to help the ferry. ‚ÄúWait!‚Äù the Phantom Stranger yells to him.

‚ÄúPerhaps you should have listened to the Stranger, Ronald,‚Äù Stein suggests, ‚ÄúHe seemed greatly concerned for our safety‚Ä¶‚Äù Ronnie turns and banks past the funnel cloud, soaring quickly down to the water‚Äôs surface. ‚ÄúCome on, Professor! Don‚Äôt forget, we‚Äôre Firestorm! What can possibly hurt us?‚Äù he answers. Stein remains concerned. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not so sure‚Ä¶I‚Äôve felt rather uneasy since we arrived,‚Äù he says anxiously, ‚ÄúThere seems to be something odd about all of this‚Ä¶I suggest you proceed with caution.‚Äù Ronnie aims a burst of restructuring energy at the ferry. Instantly, it is surrounded and protected by glass! ‚ÄúThere you go, Professor‚Ä¶I always wanted to know how they put ships into bottles,‚Äù he says, admiring his handiwork. He turns toward the dock, pulling the ferry-in-a-bottle along behind him with a nuclear tow beam. ‚ÄúNow may not be the time to mention it, but I had a strange dream last night, Ronald,‚Äù Stein reveals.

‚ÄúA‚Ä¶dream?‚Äù Ronnie asks hesitantly. He docks the ferry safely and removes the glass bottle with an atomic burst. The crowd of relieved passengers bursts into cheers and applause. ‚ÄúYes! I dreamed Firestorm was trying to kill me!‚Äù Stein continues, ‚ÄúI woke up with a most ominous feeling‚Ä¶As if someone was trying to warn us‚Ä¶‚Äù

Nearby, the strange black storm cloud glimmers with a bizarre energy. A humanoid seems to form and swirl from the very cloud itself. Lightning dances around the edges of the clouds. ‚ÄúAt last! I‚Äôve been sprung!‚Äù the humanoid cries out as it is unleashed into the sky.

Ronnie turns and focuses nuclear bursts at the funnel cloud. ‚ÄúBoy, that‚Äôs really weird, Professor!‚Äù he replies, ‚ÄúI had a dream, too! I wonder if the Stranger had anything to do with that?

The humanoid walks along the air away from the strange black cloud. Slowly, it becomes recognizable as a man. He wears a business suit and tie, and a mean, angry expression registers on his face. But he does not continue to develop into a tangible, corporeal form. He is an outline, transparent, and ghostly‚Ä¶‚ÄôShoe‚Äô Shine! ‚ÄúAfter all these months, I‚Äôm back - - just as he promised!‚Äù he grins with anticipation, ‚ÄúSoon I‚Äôll live again!‚Äù Shine walks silently in the air, stealthily approaching Firestorm unseen from behind. Stein continues to worry, saying, ‚ÄúI think we should have listened to the Stranger when‚Ä¶ARRGGGGHH!‚Äù

Suddenly, ‚ÄòShoe‚Äô Shine somehow reaches into Firestorm‚Äôs back. Incredibly, he rips the spirit form of Martin Stein right out of Firestorm! Shine flies backward, dragging the shocked and incorporeal Stein away into the air. ‚ÄúProfessor! Where are you? Professor Stein!‚Äù Ronnie calls out in surprise, unaware of what has just happened to his subconscious partner. Invisible to Ronnie, Stein and Shine wrestle desperately in the air behind him. ‚ÄúSoon, I‚Äôll live again‚Ä¶In your body, Professor Stein! Ain‚Äôt that a kick!‚Äù Shine growls, trying to choke Stein with his bare hands. ‚ÄúNo! I won‚Äôt allow it!‚Äù Stein yells, fighting back with all his might. Ronnie looks around in bewilderment. ‚ÄúProfessor Stein!‚Äù he yells, but there is no reply.

‚ÄòShoe‚Äô Shine suddenly enlarges to gigantic size before Martin Stein‚Äôs amazed eyes. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve had more experience at this spook stuff than you, Prof!‚Äù he snarls, ‚ÄúI did enough time like this to learn! You‚Äôre mine now!‚Äù He reaches his huge hand out in the air, wrapping his monstrous stubby fingers around Professor Stein. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll fight you, monster!‚Äù Stein yells, helplessly trying to escape, ‚ÄúYou won‚Äôt‚Ä¶urgh!‚Äù Shine turns abruptly, carrying Stein and running away from Firestorm in the air. ‚ÄúYou ain‚Äôt going to do nothing, Egghead!‚Äù he snaps at Stein, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre weak, like all the others! You deserve to be crushed!‚Äù He races to the blackness of the storm cloud. He flings Professor Stein into its infinite depths of darkness! ‚ÄúSo long, Prof! Enjoy your time in Hell!‚Äù he yells as the flailing Martin Stein flies into the void and disappears! ‚ÄúI won - - just like he said! ‚ÄòA soul for a soul!‚Äô I‚Äôm free!‚Äù the ghostly Shine exults. He flies from the void towards the still-confused Firestorm.

All of this, all that has happened, has taken less of our time than the blink of an eye‚Ä¶ The ghostly ‚ÄòShoe‚Äô Shine then leaps right out of the air, fusing himself directly into Firestorm! ‚ÄúProfessor! Professor - - you all right?‚Äù Ronnie asks, feeling a second presence return to his subconscious. ‚ÄúYeah‚Ä¶I‚Äôm right here, kid‚Ä¶Just went away for a second‚Ä¶‚Äù Shine answers. ‚ÄúAre you okay, Professor?‚Äù Ronnie questions, sensing something amiss, ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt sound like yourself‚Ä¶And what do you mean, ‚Äòaway?‚Äô‚Äù Shine scrambles to explain. ‚ÄúUh‚Ä¶I guess I got kind of zapped by that storm‚Ä¶But I‚Äôll be fine kid‚Ä¶er, Ronald,‚Äù he sputters, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be just fine!‚Äù Ronnie sets course back to the city. ‚Äú‚ÄôZapped?‚Äô‚Äù he asks curiously.

Seconds later, not far from WGBS-TV, the bizarre nuclear fusion that forms Firestorm is reversed once again‚Ä¶In a burst of atomic light, the two return to their separate personas in a darkened alleyway. Professor Stein looks somewhat disheveled. ‚ÄúUh‚Ä¶You sure you‚Äôre okay. Professor,‚Äù Ronnie asks with concern, ‚ÄúYou want me to call you a cab to get home?‚Äù Stein jovially reaches his hand to Ronnie‚Äôs cheek. ‚ÄúNah! I‚Äôm fine, really!‚Äù he explains, ‚ÄúIn fact, I‚Äôve never felt so fine in my whole life! Buzz off, kid. Don‚Äôt worry, I‚Äôve got some business to take care of.‚Äù Stein walks off as Ronnie watches him somewhat bewildered. ‚Äú‚ÄôBuzz off?‚Äô‚Äù Ronnie wonderingly repeats.

Meanwhile, in a realm father than the stars and yet closer to us than a heartbeat, the real Martin Stein spins and swirls in a strange whirlpool of bright orange-red energy. ‚ÄúFor the love of Heaven‚Ä¶Someone‚Ä¶Help me‚Ä¶‚Äù he calls to the emptiness. A white-gloved hand appears and reaches out to him. ‚Äú‚ÄôFor the love of Heaven‚Ä¶‚Äô Take my hand, Professor,‚Äù the Phantom Stranger tells him. ‚ÄúYou?‚Äù Stein exclaims in shock.

Later, in another part of town‚Ä¶The impostor Martin Stein stands outside the gate of a large mansion. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been around a year since I‚Ä¶er‚Ä¶took off. It‚Äôs time I put my mob back together,‚Äù he thinks, gazing at the suit-wearing guard inside. ‚ÄúHey, you!‚Äù Go tell Donna Omicidio ‚ÄòShoe‚Äô Shine wants to talk to her!‚Äù he yells to a guard. The suspicious guard looks him over, taking a puff of his cigarette. ‚ÄúShine‚Äôs dead, loser,‚Äù he replies dismissively. Shine leans his face to the gate bars. ‚ÄúGuess again, creep,‚Äù he barks back, ‚ÄúDo I look dead?‚Äù The guard walks near to take a closer look. ‚ÄúNah‚Ä¶But you don‚Äôt look like ‚ÄòShoe‚Äô Shine, either. Beat it,‚Äù he answers. Shine shoves a pointed finger out at him, arguing, ‚ÄúYou dumb goon! I tell ya I‚Äôm Shine! I can prove it! I‚Ä¶‚Äù Three more suited thugs gather in a show of force in reaction to the commotion at the gate. ‚ÄúListen, Bud!‚Äù the gate guard snorts, grabbing Shine by the lapel of Stein‚Äôs lab coat, ‚ÄúYou ever show your slimy face around here again, I‚Äôll wipe my boots on it! Now beat it!‚Äù

Shine stomps away, giving up for now. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll get you for that, Scuzball. I swear I will!‚Äù he vows, shaking his fist in anger. He walks on, pleased at his newfound place in the corporeal world. ‚ÄúAh, what the hell? Why get myself all upset,‚Äù he reconsiders with a sly smile, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs only a matter of time‚Ä¶After all, I‚Äôm Shine. I beat the odds. I made my deal with the Man himself and I‚Äôm alive again‚Ä¶I can do anything. I think I‚Äôll pay go and a visit to Charlene‚Ä¶‚Äù

Soon afterwards‚Ä¶Shine walks under a large canopy to an apartment building and proceeds in to the lobby. He finds his way to a familiar apartment and rings the doorbell. ‚ÄúCharlene! Hey, doll, it‚Äôs me!‚Äù he calls out loudly. The door swings open, and he is greeted by a buxom blonde wearing a lacey negligee. She does not recognize him as he enters. ‚ÄúHey, mister! You can‚Äôt barge in like that!‚Äù she tells him in surprise, calling to her companion, ‚ÄúFrank!‚Äù The mention of that name registers with Shine, and he slowly repeats it. A shirtless man walks from the bathroom, glaring at him. ‚ÄúBuddy, what you need is a lesson in manners‚Ä¶‚Äù he tells Shine. ‚Äú‚Ä¶Frank?‚Äù Shine asks incredulously.

And, as the reconstituted ‚ÄòShoe‚Äô Shine gets a lesson in deportment, elsewhere at the moment‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúGreat, I still have time to make it to my three o‚Äôclock job interview,‚Äù Ronnie thinks, arriving outside the WGBS-TV building. He heads in to the lobby. ‚ÄúNow let‚Äôs see‚Ä¶Fifteenth floor‚Ä¶‚Äù he thinks, glancing at a note. He steps alone into the empty elevator and presses the ‚Äò15‚Äô button. The elevator starts upwards. Then, a voice from behind startles him! ‚ÄúRonald Raymond!‚Äù it says. Ronnie turns sharply to see‚Ä¶the Phantom Stranger! ‚ÄúWhoa-boy,‚Äù he says with a gasp, ‚ÄúThere goes another job appointment down the drain‚Ä¶‚Äù

From over the Phantom Stranger‚Äôs shoulder, a ghostly image appears‚Ä¶Professor Martin Stein! ‚ÄúProfessor Stein!‚Äù Ronnie exclaims, ‚ÄúWhat - - ? I just left you an hour ago!‚Äù He glances nervously back and forth between the Phantom Stranger and the ghostly Stein. ‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt me‚Ä¶Or rather, it was my body, but not my soul,‚Äù Stein explains, ‚ÄúThe entity which now occupies my body is that of the man who tried to kill your father‚Ä¶Crime boss ‚ÄòShoe‚Äô Shine!‚Äù

The Phantom Stranger reveals more details. ‚ÄúI sent a dream to warn you! Shine‚Äôs hatred and bitterness prevented him from passing beyond,‚Äù the Stranger explains, ‚ÄúYou, Ronald, became the focus of his anger! Your unique nature as Firestorm gave him a way back into your world‚Ä¶Worse‚Ä¶to do this he made a bargain with the Unholy! A bargain not unheard of promising a soul for a soul! He traded Professor Stein‚Äôs soul for his own and used your nuclear abilities to gain corporeal existence. Still, bargains with the Unholy are never what they seem‚Ä¶As we speak, Shine is finding that the price of renewed life is higher than he imagined. Observe‚Ä¶‚Äù

The Phantom Stranger holds open his long flowing trenchcoat away from his body with his right arm, extending it like a small movie screen. An image of ‚ÄòShoe‚Äô Shine becomes visible upon it. He walks alone past a television store‚Äôs display window. A newscast attracts his attention and he stops to watch. ‚Äú‚Ä¶Mr. Raymond, what‚Äôs your reading of the public opinion polls? Should Senator Reilly resign because of his involvement with Hewitt Industries?‚Äù the political talk show host asks her guest. Ed Raymond replies, ‚ÄúWell, Bethany, first we have to consider the Senator‚Äôs record.‚Äù Shine glares furiously at the familiar face on the TV screen. ‚ÄúEvil men always look to others to blame for their sins,‚Äù the Phantom Stranger explains, ‚ÄúShine is no exception to this. Ronald, he has not forgotten, nor forgiven, your father, the man he knows as‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúRockwell!‚Äù Shine yells angrily at the television, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs all your fault! You took everything from me! My freedom! My mob! My dame! My life! Well, now I‚Äôll take something from you! I‚Äôll kill you!‚Äù Ronnie watches Shine‚Äôs fury in shock. ‚ÄúShine is crazy - - he‚Äôll try to kill my father!‚Äù he says hastily, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got to warn the police - - they‚Äôll arrest Shine and‚Ä¶‚Äù The ghostly voice of Martin Stein interjects, ‚ÄúNot Shine, Ronald‚Ä¶They‚Äôll arrest me!‚Äù Reality now dawns on Ronnie. ‚ÄúOh no‚Ä¶What‚Äôll we do?‚Äù he asks, ‚ÄúStranger! I already lost my father once! I can‚Äôt go through that again! Please help me!‚Äù

The Phantom Stranger calmly replies, ‚ÄúThere is a way, Ronald Raymond. You must force Shine to once again become a spirit. You are the only one with the power‚Ä¶You must become Firestorm!‚Äù Ronnie takes a deep breath and closes his eyes. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll try‚Ä¶‚Äù he says softly, concentrating deeply. But‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúThe kid - - he‚Äôs yankin‚Äô at me!‚Äù ‚ÄòShoe‚Äô Shine blurts, feeling Ronnie‚Äôs summons to fuse back into the Nuclear Man. Beads of sweat drip from Ronnie‚Äôs forehead. ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt‚Ä¶do it‚Ä¶He‚Äôs fighting me!‚Äù he stammers in frustration. ‚ÄúHe is a strong-willed man, but you must succeed,‚Äù the Phantom Stranger warns, ‚ÄúYour father‚Äôs life may depend on it!‚Äù On a street corner, Shine continues to resist the transformation. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not taking me, kid,‚Äù he groans, ‚ÄúI - - won‚Äôt - - let - - you!‚Äù Ronnie drops his head into his hands. He focuses all his concentration. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll do it! I have to!‚Äù he yells. Atomic rings start to envelop him. Miles away, Shine arches back with arms raised as two bullets of nuclear energy speed down upon him. ‚ÄúNooooooooo!‚Äù he yells as they slam into his body.

FZAAAAAAM! Firestorm appears in the air above the street! ‚ÄúYou think you‚Äôve won, eh, kid?‚Äù Shine hisses in Ronnie‚Äôs subconscious, ‚ÄúBut nobody beats Shine! Nobody!‚Äù Ronnie‚Äôs face is oddly angry and unsettled. ‚ÄúStranger! Professor Stein! Help me - - he‚Äôs trying to take over!‚Äù Ronnie cries out. ‚ÄúWho‚Äôs gonna help you, punk? It‚Äôs just you and me!‚Äù Shine maliciously answers, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not dealing with that wimp of a professor, you‚Äôre dealing with Shine! You‚Äôre dead meat, kid!‚Äù Ronnie flies in a racing circle around a towering office building. ‚ÄúNo! I‚Äôm stronger!‚Äù he yells, ‚ÄúThe only way you‚Äôll get control of Firestorm is over my dead body!‚Äù Their two subconscious images confront each other, fighting for control. ‚ÄúRight you are, punk!‚Äù Shine snarls, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs just what I have in mind! Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!‚Äù Somehow‚Ä¶some way‚Ä¶‚ÄôShoe‚Äô Shine wrestles himself into conscious control! ‚ÄúI did it! I‚Äôm Firestorm!‚Äù he yells in triumph as he flies, ‚ÄúNow they‚Äôll pay - - starting with that stool-pidgeon Rockwell. And then I‚Äôll take out the others! Shine is gonna own this town!

From a rooftop nearby, the Phantom Stranger and Professor Stein stare out over the city, watching Firestorm disappear into the night sky. ‚ÄúRonald! What has happened to Ronald?‚Äù a worried Stein asks. ‚ÄúThe youth has lost‚Ä¶The Dead One is now in control!‚Äù the Phantom Stranger replies, ‚ÄúYour friend still lives, Professor. But he is deeply buried inside the brute. I have no other choice but to now take matters into my own hands.‚Äù The Phantom Stranger raises his arms before him, and bolts of lightning dance out from his fingertips! ‚ÄúWhat are you doing?‚Äù Stein asks, aghast. ‚ÄúI am taking the fight to another place,‚Äù the Stranger replies calmly, ‚ÄúOne that you would call - - the ante-chamber of souls‚Ä¶‚Äù

The Phantom Stranger stands in a strange void filled with bizarre geometric shapes. To his right stands Martin Stein‚Äôs ghostly figure. Firestorm suddenly appears flying in from his left. ‚ÄúNo! I‚Äôve been cheated again!‚Äù Shine growls furiously as he looks around and sees the Phantom Stranger, ‚ÄúYou! You did this! Let me go or I‚Äôll snuff you out!‚Äù But the Phantom Stranger coolly extends his hand towards Shine. ‚ÄúHeed me, Shine!‚Äù the Stranger beckons, ‚ÄúYou cannot prevail here! This is the domain of the Phantom Stranger! A place of spirits‚Ä¶not the physical plane‚Ä¶You must not buy a new life at the expense of another‚Äôs soul. Your path now lies beyond‚Ä¶Leave this mortal world behind and come with the Phantom Stranger!‚Äù

Shine aims his hands at the Stranger and unleashes a nuclear burst! ‚ÄúForget it, Stranger!‚Äù he yells, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll force you to take me back to Earth!‚Äù The Stranger slowly raises his white-gloved hand, easily deflecting Shine‚Äôs attack. ‚ÄúYou do not have the power to compel me, Shine!‚Äù Turning back to face the Stranger, Shine uses a restructuring burst to encase him in a cube of glass! ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs where you‚Äôre wrong, pal,‚Äù he calls down, ‚ÄúI‚Äôve got Firestorm‚Äôs power! I can do anything!‚Äù

CRA-AAAACKK‚Ä¶KA-WHOOOOM! The glass cube splinters, and then explodes, blasting the void with thousands of fragments! ‚ÄúIn this world, mere physical power is not enough, Shine!‚Äù the Phantom Stranger calmly says as he strolls out of the debris, ‚ÄúBut if you must be humbled before you are ready to make the journey onward, so be it!‚Äù He joins his hands together and casts them out. His hands grow to giant proportion! ‚ÄúAAARRGGH!‚Äù Shine yells as he is grabbed in the tight grip of the Phantom Stranger! Shine breaks free, flying wildly. ‚ÄúYou must surrender this body that is not your own!‚Äù the Phantom Stranger commands. ‚ÄúMake me, mister‚Ä¶Make me!‚Äù Shine yells in defiance, ‚ÄúMaybe I lost my mob on Earth‚Ä¶But here I can make myself a new gang! Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!‚Äù

Shine aims restructuring bursts at floating debris in the void and forms them into dozens of faceless humanoids that march forth towards the Stranger! ‚ÄúNo matter what you say, as long as you‚Äôve got a physical form, Stranger, I can get you!‚Äù Shine yells, ‚ÄúMe and my ‚Äòboys‚Äô can hit you‚Ä¶Everybody hurts, everybody can die!‚Äù The Phantom Stranger stands in opposition, unmoved by Shine‚Äôs threats. ‚ÄúDo not be quick to judge all by your standards, Dead One!‚Äù he answers.

Martin Stein watches the unreal battle taking place before him. ‚ÄúHave to do something, help him somehow! But in this weird shadow world nothing seems to conform to the laws of Earthly physics,‚Äù he thinks, ‚ÄúThe Stranger is stalling. He must be hoping that the battle will engage Shine‚Äôs concentration and give Ronald the chance to fight back‚Ä¶‚Äù Suddenly, a strategy takes shape in his mind! ‚ÄúWait a minute!‚Äù Stein exclaims, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm still half of Firestorm! What if I try to summon the power to me‚Ä¶?‚Äù Stein stands and focuses his mind in concentration, and waves of energy flow from him to Firestorm. Shine is caught by surprise at the feeling, blurting, ‚ÄúHey, what‚Ä¶?‚Äù The Stranger sees the opening. ‚ÄúRonald Raymond! Now is the time for you to help your friend!‚Äù he commands. ‚ÄúGo for it, Professor!‚Äù Ronnie yells in his subconscious. Shine trembles fiercely in resistance. ‚ÄúNo! I ain‚Äôt gonna let you cheat me again! No! No! No! Nooooo!‚Äù Stein continues to concentrate, willing himself to transform into the Firestorm matrix. ‚ÄúAbandon the battle, Shine!‚Äù the Phantom Stranger commands, ‚ÄúEarth no longer wants you! It rejects you!‚Äù

Shine is pulled back into the beyond. ‚ÄúYaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhh!‚Äù he yells in agony as his spirit is ripped from Firestorm and dispatched back into the void of the departed! In Firestorm‚Äôs mind, Ronnie and Professor Stein see the lifeless body of ‚ÄòShoe‚Äô Shine lying prone before them. Ronnie senses Stein‚Äôs presence. ‚ÄúLike they say, Professor‚Ä¶It‚Äôs great to be back!‚Äù he says with relief. ‚ÄúYes, Ronald, it is‚Ä¶‚Äù Stein replies, a sense of calm returning in his mind.

‚ÄúFarewell, my friends!‚Äù the Phantom Stranger calls to them. He levitates upwards, carrying the body of ‚ÄòShoe‚Äô Shine. ‚ÄúYou have my gratitude for the help you gave to restore the natural order.‚Äù Ronnie looks up at the Stranger as he departs. ‚ÄúHey, Stranger! Wait up!‚Äù he yells, ‚ÄúHow do we get out of here? How do we get home?‚Äù

‚ÄúWe are home, Ronald‚Ä¶‚Äù Stein says, as the void melts away to reveal them standing overlooking the Manhattan skyline, ‚ÄúAnd in a way, I wonder if we ever truly left‚Ä¶‚Äù
name: Ghosts

On a date with Tawny, John Stewart recounts how he officially became the Green Lantern of sector 2814 following Hal's resignation. Meanwhile, the villain threatening the very existence of Ferris Aircraft finally reveals himself.

description:
Four Parts

"Apocalypse of the Fifth Sun!" (reprinted from Flash #306)

Opens with Doctor Fate emerging through a wall to see museum guards dressed as Aztec priests performing a sacrifice ritual, speaking in Nahautl the ancient Aztec tongue, in an attempt to raise the Aztec god of war Totec. The Boston Museum of Natural History is hosting the recently unearthed ruins of the great temple of Tenochtitlan. The touring curator of the exhibit, Dr. Olmos, has been murdered as part of a sacrifice to raise Totec.

The action shifts to Inza Nelson back in the Tower of Fate, attempting to write a novel about her life with Kent Nelson and Doctor Fate. Frustrated with the seemingly bad writing, she exclaims that she should stick with writing her diary. She remembers a recent fight with Kent about the effect that Doctor Fate has over their relationship; how, if he really loved her that Kent would give up his Fate duties. Kent responds by saying that if she truly loved him, she would accept his role as mystical protector of Earth.

Later, Inza drives to the museum in an attempt to assist Doctor Fate. She is quickly captured by Totec and used to mollify and capture Doctor Fate--Fate cannot bring himself to destroy Inza in order to attack Totec.

Totec's plan is to bring about the end of the fifth sun, or epoch, and rule the next one.

"Twilight of the Fifth Sun" (reprinted from Flash #307)

Totec is revealed to be a Lord of Chaos named Malferrazae. Since neither Fate nor Malferrazae can be killed, Totec threatens instead to destroy Fate through unannounced means. Totec (because it is easier to type :)) transports everyone to Mexico City and uses his powers to transform it and its people back 400 years. Next Fate is sent to an alternate realm named Coatepec to fight Totec's former warriors, now undead. The warriors died in a battle against another Lord of Chaos, one named by the Aztec as Totec's sister Coyolxauhqui. Fate calls upon El, husband of Asherah, the father of men and giver of strength to provide him the power to fight. Though outnumbered, Fate feels that this is just a distraction for a larger attack.

Meanwhile Totec notices a weakness, jealousy of Doctor Fate, in Inza and manifests it as a large green creature--climbing forth from Inza's mouth. That monster is sent to Coatepec to join the attack on Doctor Fate.

Back in Coatepec Fate calls upon Ptah, Lord of Creation, to create a sand beast to battle the warriors. While watching the sand beast dispatch the undead attackers, Fate is jumped from behind by the green monster.

"Dawn of the Sixth Sun" (reprinted from Flash #308)

As Fate struggles with Inza's jealousy incarnate in Coatepec, Totec taunts Inza back in our world while feeding off of her emotions. Fate is losing his battle and falls back on "...the most awesome invocation I dare speak..." then shouts "Begone, Demon-thing! Leave Me! The power of the savior compels you!" That spell causes the monster to retreat but also reveal that it is directly tied to Inza and threatens "As you would do unto me...so would you do unto the woman."

With the creature escaping through a dimensional portal, Fate declares that if Inza must die to save the world, that is acceptable. With both Fate and the monster back in our world, in California, the fight continues. The demon entraps Doctor Fate in mystical energy, dragging him up and down California which is in the throws of an earthquake.

Doctor Fate uses the time trapped to let his human body heal. Fate waits for the best moment and uses part of the sidewalk in front of Groman's theater to mold a fist which captures the monster. The demon tells Fate that this is exactly what his master wants and Fate begins to notice that the creature's voice reminds him of Inza.

Fate summons the Orb of Nabu to work out his next step. The orb shows him that if he destroys the monster, thus destroying part of Inza, Kent Nelson would reject his destiny. Thus, he decides that he must reunite the jealousy incarnate with Inza Nelson.

Fate rescues Inza and flies her to him. The creature takes this opportunity to shift form, becoming a multi-headed serpent and attacks Fate, ripping the Helmet of Nabu off his head. This causes the spell carrying Inza to stop, sending her plummeting to the ground.

Separated from Nabu, Kent Nelson's consciousness finds Inza lying motionless in the earthquake debris.

"Tomorrow is Forever" (reprinted from Flash #309)

Awakened with little knowledge of what has transpired, Kent Nelson is shocked to find his wife lying broken and seemingly dead. As he scoops up her body, Inza speaks to him from the astral plane, where her spirit escaped before her body's death--protected by her exposure to Fate over the years.

The demon, being drawn from Inza's jealousy, realizes that the Helmet is the only means by which she can control Kent Nelson. She stops her return to Totec and takes the form of a woman to taunt Kent Nelson. She wants Kent to join her and her alone. Seeing this obsession, Kent kisses the dried corpse of Inza which enrages the creature. Distracted by the overwhelming emotions, the monster isn't ready for Kent Nelson's physical attack.

The spread of the mystically created earthquake reaches Boston, where we met the new head of the Boston Museum of Natural History--Doctor Copeland.

Back in California, Kent recovers the helmet and becomes Doctor Fate again, banishing the monster back into Inza. Being part of Inza's life force, the reunification with the creature restores her human body to life.

Doctor Fate, pushing the limits of his powers, grows in size until he can stand atop the Earth itself and spins a spell that repairs the ground faults to stop the earthquakes and destroys Totec.

As the issue ends, Dr. Copeland is researching Kent Nelson and stumbles over a picture of Inza Nelson, who he finds completely beautiful.

name: Aftermath--and Prologue

description:
"The way home is the longest way of all."

-- from the teachings of Rahani

On New Bhok, Jogarr tells Superman of how he and the other Red Saturnians came to live on New Bhok. Meanwhile, Jemm is chased across the New York City skyline by Koolar's after escaping with Luther and Bouncer from the ship of Commander Synn.

Claudius Tull has several assassins disguised as Red Saturnians murder Senator Frank Berkley.
name: Return Flight

description: Inqurires into a supposed family heirloom left behind by her deceased father leads detective Jonni Thunder into discovering the statuette that gives her the power of Thunderbolt when she grasps it!
name: ... Not in the Stars But in Ouselves...!

description:
Seventy million years ago, the dinosaurs were driven to extinction. In Detroit, the Justice League of America assemble, to discuss the Vixen's break-in, at a local prison. Steel angrily argues with Aquaman. Aquaman uses his telepathic powers to calm Steel. Only J'onn J'onzz, the Manhunter From Mars, is aware of what Aquaman has done. Sue Dibny questions Aquaman's intentions towards the Vixen. Dibny is, essentially, told to mind her own business. The Gypsy reveals herself to Steel. Fastball attacks the Gypsy, and Steel. Steel uses a massive slab of concrete to block Fastball's second volley, then crushes Fastball under the slab.

The Justice League of America rush to Steel's defense. Vibe attempts to question the Gypsy, but she disappears. The Martian Manhunter notes that Fastball, too, has disappeared, leaving behind a potential clue. The Vixen storms the M'Changa embassy in New York. The Vixen attacks General Mustapha Maksai. Having underestimated Maksai's physical prowess, the Vixen suddenly finds herself at a distinct disadvantage. Calling on the power of her Tantu Totem, the Vixen escapes Maksai's crushing grip, and attempts to flee. The Vixen is shot trying to escape. Maksai's security forces race outside the embassy to collect the Vixen.

The Justice League of America pacify Maksai's security forces. The New York Police Department arrives on the scene. Maksai dismisses the police, stating the sovereign law of M'Changa holds sway over the embassy. The police still attempt to arrest the Vixen, for breaking in to a prison in Detroit. Aquaman defies the arresting officers, and departs, with the Vixen. Steel commends Aquaman on his defiance of the police. Aquaman tells Steel to shut up. Zatanna points out that the Justice League of America is not above the law, and that Aquaman should have turned the Vixen over to the police. Steel reveals a bit of his origin to Zatanna.

Of note is that the operation that transformed Hank Heywood into Steel seemed to be entirely unnecessary, and not altogether voluntary. Zatanna is horrified that Steel's own grandfather would do such a thing to him. The Justice League of America is suddenly teleported to the secret stronghold of the Overmaster. There, the Justice League of America must face the Cadre, or die.
name: Heavy Metal

description:
The Legion of Super-Heroes faces "The Choice of Dooms!"

Ultra Boy, Phantom Girl, Chameleon Boy, Element Lad and Shrinking Violet are still lost in space and find an inhabited planet during their travels and lands, and learn they are trying to build a Sun-Eater on that planet. Meanwhile, Lightning Lass learns that she is an aunt after she returns to the Legion of Super-Heroes. THe missing Legionnaires decide to sacrifice their chance of going home to remain and destroy the machines that are trying to build the Sun-Eater.
name: A Choice of Dooms

description: The Omega Men fight Branx demons to save Nimbus's soul. Meanwhile, Shlagen attempts to stop the Dredfahlians from destroying his body.
name: Body and Soul... Or Degrees of Death

  3. "The Master Plan of Dr. Phosphorus" reprinted from Detective Comics #470.
  4. "Hell Park" reprinted from House of Mystery #274.

To Steal A Sun: Precious Moments

  2. "Born to be Superman!" "Chapter One: Clark Kent" "Chapter 2: Lex Luthor" "Chapter 3: The Man of Steel!" written by Paul Kupperberg, penciled by Carmine Infantino, inked by Bob Oksner, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Milt Snapinn.

description:
1. Cover by Frank Miller.
  2. "Dreams and Schemes and Feeling Proud!" written by Bob Rozakis, penciled by Curt Swan, inked by Kurt Schaffenberger, colored by Tom Ziuko and lettered by John Costanza.

After graduation from Smallville High School and the death of Ma and Pa Kent, Clark Kent (and Superboy) moved to Metropolis to attend college. Little has been revealed about these times...until now! THIS ISSUE: Lex Luthor escapes from reform school and makes his way to Metropolis to cause trouble for the Boy of Steel in "Dreams and Schemes and Feeling Proud!"
name: Dreams and Schemes and Feeling Proud!

description:
You are cordially invited to the wedding of Terry Long and Donna Troy! Featuring cameo appearances by Superman, Batman and more!

50th issue special!

Wonder Girl is getting married and all the golden age Titans and the team's mentors show up for the celebration.
